newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-MILAN'S REIZIGER HAS WHIPLASH AFTER CAR ACCIDENT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MILAN'S REIZIGER HAS WHIPLASH AFTER CAR ACCIDENT.

text.p: AC Milan's Dutch international defender Michael Reiziger is suffering from whiplash after being involved in a car accident on Saturday, Italian media reports said.
Reiziger was driving to training with Dutch team mate Edgar Davids when the accident happened on a motorway outside Milan, the reports said.
Reiziger was taken to hospital where he was given a neck brace for mild whiplash. It was not immediately clear for how long he would have to wear the brace.
Midfielder Davids was unhurt and took part in the warm-up for the Italian champions' match against Perugia on Sunday.
It was the third car accident involving a Milan player in less than a year.
Last February, George Weah and French defender Patrick Vieira escaped virtually unharmed when the Liberian striker's car hit a guard rail in northern Italy.
Speedy striker Marco Simone was also fortunate when he suffered only minor injuries after a crash last summer.
